messages.title: Peterborough Deserves Better - Vote Labour
messages.content: Vote for Fiona Onasanya on June 8th. Solicitor Fiona Onasanya is Labour's candidate for the Peterborough constituency. A former Cambridgeshire county councillor, she was also the Labour Spokesperson for Children, Young People, and Families. Fiona lives in Paston. Fiona stated 'I'm very proud to have been selected to be the candidate for Peterborough. This is my home! I regard this campaign as an opportunity to fight for you.' 'The people of Peterborough deserve better than what the current government is giving them. Pensioners should be protected.'

keyPolicies.policyTitle: A Brexit to Protect Working People
keyPolicies.policyDescription: Labour is the party of work. Our top priority is the welfare of working people; we demand a deal that protects jobs and living standards. The Labour Party strongly believes the first priority of Britain's negotiations should be to protect jobs and workers' hard-won rights. The Tories don't appear to understand that unemployment is a terrible tragedy.

Crime continues to plague Peterborough; Tory cuts to police forces have left many vulnerable. According to police statistics, there were 5625 violent and sexual offences in Peterborough between March 2016 and February 2017. In the same period, there were 8950 reported instances of anti-social behaviour. Labour suggests more police officers on the beat and a safer, equitable society. We have a fully costed plan to put 10,000 additional police officers on the beat.

The Tory government is destroying our children's prospects. Peterborough's SATs results are among the worst in the country due to cuts. 'Without a proper education, our children will merely have functional skills.' Fiona says, 'The Labour Party is committed to policies which will restore proper funding to our schools, bring back specialist teachers, improve teacher recruitment and retention, and increase classroom aides.'
